title: Allegiant Inaugurates Nonstop Flights From Three U.S. Cities To Fort Lauderdale With Fares As Low As $59Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Allegiant Inaugurates Nonstop Flights From Three U.S. Cities To Fort Lauderdale With Fares As Low As $59
Allegiant today inaugurates nonstop flights to Fort Lauderdale from Portsmouth, N.H on Oct. 1, 2015., Akron / Canton, Ohio on Oct. 2, 2015 and Rochester, N.Y on Oct. 9, 2015. The company, known for its exceptional travel deals, is offering one-way fares to Fort Lauderdale as low as $59*.
“Allegiant is pleased to announce new flights from these three markets, giving these communities their first nonstop, ultra-low-cost option to the sunny vacation destination of Fort Lauderdale,” said Jude Bricker, Allegiant Travel Company senior vice president of planning. “We couldn’t be more pleased with how Fort Lauderdale has embraced our service and we look forward to bringing more visitors and economic growth to the area.”
The new flights will operate twice weekly and expand on the service Allegiant currently operates to Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood International Airport (FLL). Focusing on leisure travelers, the new flights will bring nearly 9,000 additional visitors each year to the Fort Lauderdale area and generate over an estimated $7 million in total visitor spending annually.
“The Broward County Aviation Department welcomes Allegiant’s new service and doubling in growth year-over-year, at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. We wish them continued success as they pursue new markets for travelers to visit Broward County,” said Kent George, Broward County Aviation director of aviation.
New routes launching to Fort Lauderdale / Hollywood International Airport (FLL) include:
Portsmouth, N. H. – Oct. 1, 2015 with fares as low as $59* Akron / Canton, Ohio – Oct. 2, 2015 with fares as low as $60* Rochester, N.Y. – Oct. 9, 2015 with fares as low as $69*
“We are thrilled to welcome new service from these three feeder markets offering direct routes we currently don’t have. It is with great partnerships such as the one with Allegiant that FLL is ranked a top international airport by the industry,” said Nicki E. Grossman, president of the Greater Fort Lauderdale Convention & Visitors Bureau.
Allegiant’s innovative business model has allowed it to grow from one plane and one route to offering access to low-cost flights in over 100 cities nationwide, more than any other domestic low-cost carrier. Allegiant passengers can enjoy unique savings by bundling their air, hotel, car and even activity and attraction reservations together for less.
Source:- Allegiant Air
